messages: 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (09:51): jruderman, you just left but in case you read the logs I suppose I can figure out if we want to share that today
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (09:52): weinig, I am here now, haven't checked my e-mail yet though in case you e-mailed your question
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:05): replies to an ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 e-mail and a b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea e-mail from nov 2004
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:05): finishes editing the normalization wiki page
ac35308fff7abada50397bb69d5658e2 (10:05): is glad he's still alive to read the reply :-)
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:05): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, there is no base URL concept in HTML5 that I can use here?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:06): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: as far as i can tell, the behavior you are describing is not one that anything in html5 has
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:06): I wonder how to make it work in such a way that it will also work in Web Workers
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:07): I suppose I have to provide a hook for Web Workers
62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc (10:09): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: what's the URL for the normalization wiki page? I don't see it mentioned in the logs
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:09): 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc: http://esw.w3.org/topic/I18N/CanonicalNormalization

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:10): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: yeah just add a hook that says "if the XMLHttpRequest object's constructor is not on a Window object, then the /XMLHttpRequest base URI/ is defined by another specification." or some such
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:11): the problem is that currently it is wrong
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:11): because currently it only has a base URL once constructed
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:11): it needs to change so that the interface object has an associated base URL
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:14): e.g. in case the interface object gets copied across Windows before any object creation takes place
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:14): Interesting, it turns out that what I said in 2004 isn't entirely stupid
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:15): "H:TML" is confusing

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:16): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: the full title is long and I want to avoid expressions like "Mike's document" and &quot 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e's document"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:17): i don't really think "The Markup Language" is the least ambiguous of names, but I'm not really sure what a better name would be
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:18): it looks like a qname
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:18): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: your imagination has been dirtied by XML!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:33): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: should cssom be in charge of firing onresize and onscroll events?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:35): CSSOM View maybe, yeah
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:35): though maybe not for this revision of that document
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): is there an ETA on the revision that would include this?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): (for planning purposes)
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:38): I don't really know, I want to work out XHR and CORS
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:38): I suppose alternatively it could be included and it would just sit longer in WD status
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:38): I don't really mind WD status, but some people do
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:39): i can work with 2015, sure
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:40): (you don't have a timetable for when things like xhr will be done?)
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:40): I did, but then HTML5 raised the bar
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:41): heh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:41): well html5's timetable has been pretty well established for several years now, you should have expected changes :-)

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:41): also, implementors are not really helping that much  62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcart from when 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fc was still reviewing) so it's hard to figure out how much is still to be done
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:42): ah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:42): you'll get better at estimating it with more experience i expect
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:42): took me years to get an idea of how long it would take
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:42): but now it is mainly figuring out how to deal with the base URL issue and event loops for XHR 1
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:42): for XHR 2 it depends on when the File Upload stuff gets done
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:43): yeah i have a bunch of stuff waiting on file upload

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): i think it's ridiculous that after years of people complaining about how html5 wasn't going to be ready for them in time, html5 is now blocking on other specs
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:44): CORS is done, 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcart from non-normative details and server requirements and potential feedback from implementors
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): cool
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:45): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: so CORS will use Origin regardless of how the more general ID goes?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, there are three known implementations of CORS that use Origin and will ship soonish
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, of which one at least has indicated it cannot be possibly changed
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, not counting Chrome here

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, so I guess that although I 62c428533830d84fd8bc77bf402512fcpreciate the discussion on the HTTP WG mailing list, it's pretty much a done deal
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:48): someone should tell the http group
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:48): (not it!)
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:48): "not it!"?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:49): I'm not sure they care much for reality, but I suppose I can give it try if the discussion surfaces again
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:50): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: as in http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VT8uiT_rZ5k ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:51): "not it" is an idiomatic english expression meaning "i decline to volunteer for the responsibility that has most recently been put on the table"
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:51): I love Borat
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (10:56): time to go to work o_O
